shore something ↔ up.translation[0].defi: to support a wall or roof with large pieces of wood, metal etc to stop it from falling down
The roof had been shored up with old timbers.
to help or support something that is likely to fail or is not working well
attempts to shore up the struggling economy
shore something ↔ up.translation[1].defi: to help a system or organization that is likely to fail or is not working well
The company was shored up by an emergency infusion of cash from its main bank.
